dataset.title: MCR LTER: Coral Reef: Benthic Water Temperature, ongoing since 2005

abstract.para: A continuous time series of water temperature is measured with bottom-mounted thermistors at six sites around the shores of Moorea, on the fringing reef, backreef, and forereef. The forereef temperature is recorded at 10, 20, 30 and 40 m, the backreef at 1 m and the fringing reef at 1 and 5 m. SBE 39s are deployed to the forereef and backreef. Onset HOBOs are deployed on the fringing reef. Temperature data are processed and resampled to a 20 minute time step.

keywordSet.keyword: Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: GCMD Keywords, Version 6.0.0.0.0: EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans:

intellectualRights.para:
Data collected under the auspices of the MCR LTER are available to the public after primary publication, or at most two years after the completion of the study unless proprietary restrictions are warranted. Use of MCR LTER data is subject to acceptance of the following conditions:
1. The user agrees to provide valid name and contact information prior to downloading online data. This information will be used to contact the user in case of changes to the data, and may also be used by data set authors and MCR LTER project administrators to document data usage.
2. The user agrees to cite the data set author and MCR LTER in all publications in which the data are used, as per the instructions in the data documentation. If no specific instructions are provided in the data documentation, the user is requested to include the following statement: "Data sets were provided by the Moorea Coral Reef Ecosystem LTER, funded by the US National Science Foundation (OCE-0417412)."
3. The user agrees to provide one copy of any manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the data set author prior to submitting it for publication.
4. The user agrees to send two hard copies of any published manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the following address: Dr. Andrew J. Brooks Deputy Program Director, MCR LTER Marine Science Institute University of California Santa Barbara, CA 93106-6150 The user also agrees to send one electronic copy (pdf format) to the following e-mail address: brooks@msi.ucsb.edu
5. Users are prohibited from selling or redistributing any data provided by MCR LTER without explicit prior permission.
6. Users are encouraged to contact original investigators responsible for data. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on MCR LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
7. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and the MCR LTER will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.
8. Any violation of the terms of this agreement will result in immediate forfeiture of the data and loss of access privileges to other MCR LTER data sets.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: LTER 1 polygon including LTER 0 on north shore

description.para: This is an ongoing dataset. There is an aproximate 3 month delay between collection of raw data and the analysis. Public release is not delayed after data is processed for all depths above 30 m.

changeHistory.comment: New data recieved 2012-02-28, replaces sites 1-6, but not site 0.

Bottom mounted thermistor deployments from some sites were found to have been improperly adjusted from Moorea Local Time to GMT. There was a 10 day instead of 10 hour offset applied to many of the first deployments. The error appears to have not affected deployments after mid 2006 except for some 30m and 40m 2009 deployments at FOR03 and FOR06. Please see item (31) in the MCR_LTER_PhysOcean_processing_log.txt for a detailed list of adjusted data files.

section.title: Deployment and Maintenance:
section.para: Thermistors are serviced every 6 months by SCUBA divers for routine maintenance and to upload data.

protocol.title: HOBO Pro v2 Water Temperature Data Logger - U22-001

methodStep.instrumentation: 64K HOBO Pro v2 Water Temperature Data Logger - U22-001 with a range of -40 to 70 degrees Celsius, manufactured by Onset Computer Corporation
64M SeaBird Water Temperature Recorder with a range of -5 to 35 degrees Celsius, manufactured by Sea-Bird Electronics, Inc.

section.title: Data Handling:
section.para: Data are filtered and processed to derive calculated data products and for quality control. Raw data are recorded at a short time interval, then processed to remove noise and resampled at 3 points per hour.

section.title: Revisions:
section.para: Bottom mounted thermistor deployments from some sites were found to have been improperly adjusted from Moorea Local Time to GMT. There was a 10 day instead of 10 hour offset applied to many of the first deployments. The error appears to have not affected deployments after mid 2006 except for some 30m and 40m 2009 deployments at FOR03 and FOR06. Please see item (31) in the MCR_LTER_PhysOcean_processing_log.txt for a detailed list of adjusted data files.

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Biological Sciences, California State University
Department of Biological Sciences, California State University

dataTable.entityDescription: Temperature data from bottom-mounted thermistors at site LTER 1

attribute.attributeDefinition: Name of field site.

codeDefinition.definition: LTER00 is within the LTER 1 public polygon; North shore. LTER00 FOR is 300m west of the FOR01 mooring.
Within the LTER 1 site; North shore. LTER01 FOR is at the FOR01 mooring.
Within the LTER 2 site; North shore.
Within the LTER 3 site; Southeast shore.
Within the LTER 4 site; Southeast shore. LTER04 FOR is at the FOR04 mooring.
Within the LTER 5 site; Southwest shore. LTER05 FOR is at the FOR05 mooring.
Within the LTER 6 site; Southwest shore.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Moorea local time string (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss) at start of bin
UTC time string (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss) at start of bin
The type of reef habitat: Fringing reef, Backreef, or Forereef.

codeDefinition.definition: Fringing Reef. Nearest to shore.
Backreef. Toward the island side of the reef crest.
Forereef. Faces open ocean.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Model of thermistor.

codeDefinition.definition: HOBO thermistor. Accuracy 0.2 celsius.
SeaBird SBE 39 temperature recorder. Accuracy 0.002 celsius.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Depth of thermistor. Positive is down.
Ambient water temperature, measured with thermistor.

quantitativeAttributeAccuracyAssessment.attributeAccuracyValue: HOBO: +/-0.2 celsius over 0 to 50 celsius and SBE 39: +/-0.002 celsius
quantitativeAttributeAccuracyAssessment.attributeAccuracyExplanation: HOBO: Resolution 0.02 celsius at 20 to 30 celsius and SBE 39: 0.0001 celsius
